snippet: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much.
abstract: Germany's World Cup rout of Brazil is vivid reminder of how the fortunes of host country's national soccer team can mirror how Brazilians view their society even as other traumas recede into history; humiliating loss stings for many Brazilians but others are trying to put loss in perspective and wonder how much it really matters.

byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, Lucy Jordan from Brasília, and Seth Kugel from São Paulo, Brazil.

lead_paragraph: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much.

headline.main: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss
